channel.title: Security Images
channel.description:
Well, Im trying to make a Scar script for a text based game, but it uses those security images. (See attachement.) What is the best way let Scar recognise the images? I can only think of two ways: saving all the images first (that takes ages) or somehow let Scar detect them by itself. The images can have two background colors, black and white. The letters have various colors but only one color per image.
Can you guys please tell me of a good way? Thanks in advance.
Edit: Maby this is supposed to be in the Scar section. If so can a mod move this? Edit 2: Thanks Kmb for moving.

item.title: Security Images
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Oh, Oh well Ill just play the game the normal way then. Thanks for your help guys.

Read full topic

item.title: Security Images
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

But how did they do it with AutoRune? When sleeping you had to fill what an image said aswell. I know AutoRune is totally different then Scar but still…

It wasn’t as complex as this.

Read full topic

item.title: Security Images
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

But how did they do it with AutoRune? When sleeping you had to fill what an image said aswell. I know AutoRune is totally different then Scar but still…

I don’t know how AR worked, really, but either it read the code, used a different technique (Scar basically only has the one by one image recognition thing) or Rs’s security pictures were very easy.

If they only have like 2 fonts and such and you’re dedicated you could get them all.

Read full topic

item.title: Security Images
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

But how did they do it with AutoRune? When sleeping you had to fill what an image said aswell. I know AutoRune is totally different then Scar but still…

item.title: Security Images
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

It would be extremely difficult.

For one reason; Good Security images use tens to hundreds of different Fonts, Styles and colours.
You’d need to get every possible version of every letter and number.

Give up.

Read full topic

item.title: Security Images
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

The whole point of these security images is to stop programs like SCAR.

Read full topic
